column1: Problem Statement
As electric vehicle (EV) adoption surges
column2: urban planners need to anticipate infrastructure needs ‚Äî especially charging stations.

column1: Inadequate planning can lead to bottlenecks
This project builds a regression model to forecast future EV adoption demand
column2: based on historical trends in EV growth

column1: Goal
‚úÖ Use the provided dataset to predict the number of electric vehicles (EVs) in future months/years.
‚úÖ Help urban planners make better decisions about charging infrastructure needs.
‚úÖ Provide historical vs forecasted EV growth insights at the county level.
Dataset
We used the dataset published by the Washington State Department of Licensing (DOL) which contains monthly EV registration records.
Dataset Link:
üîó Kaggle Dataset
Features
Date: End of the month when counts were recorded (2017-01-31 ‚Üí 2024-02-29)
County: Region where vehicle owner resides
State: U.S. state of registration
Vehicle Primary Use: Passenger (~83%) or Truck (~17%)
Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs): Fully electric vehicles
Plug-In Hybrid Electric Vehicles (PHEVs): Partially electric vehicles
Electric Vehicle (EV) Total: BEVs + PHEVs
Non-Electric Vehicle Total: All other vehicles
Total Vehicles: Sum of all powered vehicles
Percent Electric Vehicles: Percentage of EVs in total vehicles
